bug.short_desc: SELinux is preventing docker-containe from using the 'sigchld' accesses on a process.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Trying to start a docker container (any) SELinux is preventing docker-containe from using the 'sigchld' accesses on a process.
***** Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests **************************
If you believe that docker-containe should be allowed sigchld access on processes labeled unconfined_service_t by default. Then you should report this as a bug. You can generate a local policy module to allow this access. Do allow this access for now by executing: # ausearch -c 'docker-containe' --raw | audit2allow -M my-dockercontaine # semodule -X 300 -i my-dockercontaine.pp
Additional Information: Source Context system_u:system_r:container_t:s0:c94,c203 Target Context system_u:system_r:unconfined_service_t:s0 Target Objects Unknown [ process ] Source docker-containe Source Path docker-containe Port <Unknown> Host (removed) Source RPM Packages Target RPM Packages Policy RPM selinux-policy-3.13.1-225.16.fc25.noarch Selinux Enabled True Policy Type targeted Enforcing Mode Permissive Host Name (removed) Platform Linux (removed) 4.10.16-200.fc25.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon May 15 15:19:52 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 Alert Count 5 First Seen 2017-05-19 17:10:22 EDT Last Seen 2017-05-19 19:23:00 EDT Local ID 8ed20c80-6159-4da1-ac31-38efca5b8392
Raw Audit Messages type=AVC msg=audit(1495236180.187:846): avc: denied { sigchld } for pid=15940 comm="docker-containe" scontext=system_u:system_r:container_t:s0:c94,c203 tcontext=system_u:system_r:unconfined_service_t:s0 tclass=process permissive=1
Hash: docker-containe,container_t,unconfined_service_t,process,sigchld
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-225.16.fc25.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.8.0 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.10.16-200.fc25.x86_64 type: libreport

This looks like the docker-containerd process is running with the wrong label. Please update the container-selinux package out of testing and see if this fixes your issue.
dnf -y update container-selinux --enable updates-testing
systemctl restart docker
